intro: Cyrtandromoea pterocaulis, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically narrow and linear. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Cyrtandromoea pterocaulis is adapted to cold climates and is a hardy species with a long history of botanical study.
